docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc is close to finalizing negotiations to acquire peer Cigna Inc and could announce a roughly $48 billion deal as early as this week, two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

headline.main: Anthem Set to Announce Deal for Cigna This Week: Sources
headline.print_headline: Anthem Set to Announce Deal for Cigna This Week: Sources

docs.snippet: U.S. health insurer Anthem Inc is close to finalizing negotiations to acquire peer Cigna Inc and could announce a roughly $48 billion deal as early as this week, two people familiar with the matter said on Wednesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: It was 8 o'clock on a weeknight and Brooklyn resident Sarah Sheehan was reeling from a painful earache.

docs.lead_paragraph: It's getting more expensive to be an employer and small business owners say that's making it harder for them to make money.

headline.main: Costs From Regulations Pile Up, Hurt Small Business Profits
headline.print_headline: Costs From Regulations Pile Up, Hurt Small Business Profits

docs.snippet: It's getting more expensive to be an employer and small business owners say that's making it harder for them to make money.

docs.lead_paragraph: Randomized trials of patients with terminal cancer point to a new approach on palliative care, one that Medicare will test more widely.

headline.main: Medicare to Try a Blend of Hospice Care and Treatment
headline.print_headline: Testing a Blend of Hospice Care and Treatment

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Medicare introduces pilot program that will let terminally ill patients receive hospice care and end-of-life-planning while still receiving medical treatments for their illnesses; program is outgrowth of research that has shown blended approach can offer both better quality of life and reduced costs.
docs.snippet: Randomized trials of patients with terminal cancer point to a new approach on palliative care, one that Medicare will test more widely.

docs.lead_paragraph: Federal investigators said Tuesday that thousands of doctors and other health care providers had signed up to bill Medicare using “questionable addresses” like mailbox rental stores and vacant lots.

headline.main: Federal Report Says Many Doctors Use False Addresses for Medicare
headline.print_headline: Federal Report Says Many Doctors Use False Addresses for Medicare

docs.abstract: Government Accountability Office investigators say thousands of doctors and health care providers have used 'questionable' addresses to bill Medicare and that Medicare has not verified addresses adequately; warn that invalid addresses could indicate fraud.
docs.snippet: Federal investigators said Tuesday that thousands of doctors and other health care providers had signed up to bill Medicare using “questionable addresses” like mailbox rental stores and vacant lots.

docs.lead_paragraph: The main contractor in Maryland’s initially flawed health care exchange website has agreed to repay $45 million to avoid legal action, officials announced Tuesday.

headline.main: Maryland: Contractor to Pay for Flawed Website Design
headline.print_headline: Maryland: Contractor to Pay for Flawed Website Design

docs.abstract: Noridian Healthcare Solutions agrees to repay $45 million to avoid legal action over its role in failure of Maryland's flawed health care exchange website, which crashed as soon as it went online as part of Affordable Care Act.
docs.snippet: The main contractor in Maryland’s initially flawed health care exchange website has agreed to repay $45 million to avoid legal action, officials announced Tuesday.

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject

docs.lead_paragraph: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.

headline.main: Health Care Tax Faces United Opposition From Labor and Employers

docs.abstract: Many employers are concerned about looming burden of Cadillac Tax--40 percent excise tax on more expensive health care plans--that will take effect as part of Affordable Care Act in 2018; some companies have begun accelerating efforts to introduce less expensive plans, while others have joined with labor unions to push for repeal of tax.
docs.snippet: The so-called Cadillac tax, to be imposed starting in 2018 on plans costing over a certain amount, is prompting companies and unions to come together to call for its repeal.

docs.lead_paragraph: Yet PartnerRe said that its board still believed that a proposed merger with Axis Capital was “superior in value, terms and certainty of closing.”

headline.main: PartnerRe Willing to Negotiate With Exor After Latest Offer
